instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> perfect repair, how the ebay repair guy repairs look like....
threads.message:
got a MacBook pro in last night. customer bought this MacBook working. after 2 weeks the screen turned off.
he went to the internet (because the seller magicly disapeared)  found a repair program for the video issue.

so he send his MacBook to apple. and they declined the repair.
pre fucked something.

wel how beautiful does this look like.
btw i gues he didnt need the other parts on the board

cheap versus exspensive, if i am done ill uploade the image. (if the customer wants it repaired that is)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> perfect repair, how the ebay repair guy repairs look like....
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> perfect repair, how the ebay repair guy repairs look like....
threads.message: It's a bit crusty but nothing horrible. Probably an easy fix replacing <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> and clean up the wires. Maybe swap the LCD connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> perfect repair, how the ebay repair guy repairs look like....
threads.message:
yea it does not look like a rabbit hole, and maby i am a bit of a acid pisser.
but would this leave your shop?
no cleaning ultra soon.
everywhere on the board still oxidation.
small capps looking like they will die next week.

and just dipping the wire against a leg.......

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> perfect repair, how the ebay repair guy repairs look like....
threads.message: I at least clean all the corrosion off. I usually don't bother to clean up flux unless it is really bad. The caps in the picture look ok, I would not have touched them.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> perfect repair, how the ebay repair guy repairs look like....
threads.message:
No indeed the ones with the wire on are good. 
It is on the Other side of the fan on the edge they are crispy black on alot of sides. 
Even the pads where crispy
